paper_metadata.title: Creating large, high-quality geospatial datasets from historical maps using novice volunteers

evidence.observation: Maps are 1:50,000 scale Soviet military topographic maps dating to the 1980s

implicit_evidence.assessor_notes: Based on authors' experience but scope of 'often' not quantified

evidence.verbatim_quote: In our experience, digitisation work associated with archaeological research often proceeds under such conditions

evidence.claim_text: FAIMS Mobile supported production of a customised map digitisation system with simple UI and streamlined workflow while providing essential features
evidence.assessor_notes: Key capability claim for platform selection
evidence.coi_note: Authors are FAIMS developers - capability claim about their platform
evidence.verbatim_quote: this system met the functional requirements we identified for geospatial software. It supported the production of a customised map digitisation system with a simple UI and streamlined workflow, while still providing essential features

evidence.claim_text: FAIMS Mobile allowed testing the idea that usability approaches from kinetic fieldwork were beneficially transferable to digitisation work

location.verbatim_quote: it allowed us to test the idea that usability approaches from data capture during kinetic fieldwork were beneficially transferable to digitisation work

location.claim_text: Reusing FAIMS Mobile for digitisation offered consistent working environment, reduced admin load, leveraged experience, and avoided additional costs
location.coi_note: Authors are FAIMS developers - advantage claims about reusing their platform

location.verbatim_quote: Reusing the platform for digitisation offered a consistent working environment for users, reduced administrative load on staff, leveraged our experience with the platform, and avoided any additional hardware or software costs

location.claim_text: Student volunteers are accustomed to and prefer slippy-map touch-screen interfaces over point-and-click desktop UI
information_gaps: What evidence supports this preference claim?
Based on which studies or observations?

implicit_evidence.assessor_notes: Claim about student preferences presented as known fact without evidence

location.verbatim_quote: student volunteers are accustomed to, and even prefer, 'slippy-map', touch-screen interfaces on mobile devices over the point-and-click, desktop UI idiom

location.claim_text: Use of mobile interface would make it easier for students to learn the system and more likely to stick with digitisation
location.assessor_notes: Hypothesized benefit - appropriately hedged as belief

location.verbatim_quote: We believed that the use of the former would make it easier for students to learn the system, and more likely to stick with digitisation

location.claim_text: Mobile choice reduced competition for limited computers, ESRI licenses, and desk space in the field

location.verbatim_quote: This choice also reduced competition for the limited number of computers, ESRI licences, and desk space available in the field

location.claim_text: Mobile choice allowed students to use their own devices

location.verbatim_quote: plus it allowed students to use their own devices

location.claim_text: Open-source software customised via code offers redeployability and transparency advantages

location.verbatim_quote: we preferred the use of open-source software customised via code for its redeployability and transparency advantages

location.claim_text: No existing system met requirements off-the-shelf without significant customisation

location.verbatim_quote: No existing system met these requirements 'off-the-shelf', without significant customisation

location.claim_text: No competing product offered enough advantage to justify adopting a second geospatial recording system

location.verbatim_quote: no competing product offered enough of an advantage to justify adopting a second geospatial recording system

location.claim_text: Digitisation of scanned maps deviated from core FAIMS Mobile use-case of field data collection
location.assessor_notes: Important context for platform adaptability test

location.verbatim_quote: Digitisation of scanned maps deviated from the 'core' FAIMS Mobile use-case of field data collection

location.claim_text: Map digitisation served as both a test of platform adaptability and exploration of potential benefits from repurposing mobile field data capture apps

location.verbatim_quote: it served both as a test of the platform's adaptability, and as an exploration of the potential benefits offered by repurposing mobile applications for field data capture to digitisation projects

location.claim_text: The workflow moved activities requiring technical expertise to phases where specialists could contribute

location.verbatim_quote: This approach moved activities requiring technical expertise to phases where specialists could contribute, while simplifying the tasks assigned to student volunteers as much as possible

location.claim_text: Users required almost no training and could focus on digitisation without being distracted by technology
location.assessor_notes: Key usability claim - connects to earlier training time claim

implicit_evidence.assessor_notes: Training requirement claim without measurement documentation

location.verbatim_quote: As a result, users required almost no training and could focus on the act of digitisation without being distracted by the technology used to accomplish it

location.claim_text: Exported data was consistent and complete, ready for analysis with minimal cleaning
location.assessor_notes: Data quality claim - will be validated in Results section
location.verbatim_quote: Exported data was consistent and complete, ready for analysis with minimal cleaning

implicit_arguments.argument: Offline capability is essential for scaling to large numbers of contributors in field contexts
implicit_arguments.assessment_notes: Links offline functionality to scalability claim - assumption that field contexts generally lack reliable connectivity

implicit_arguments.argument: The approach depends on general principles (simplified UI, offline capability, mobile-first) rather than FAIMS-specific features
implicit_arguments.assessment_notes: Necessary assumption for transferability claim - if approach is FAIMS-specific, cannot be replicated on other platforms

implicit_arguments.argument: Volunteer independence is valuable enough to justify upfront system development investment
implicit_arguments.assessment_notes: Design goal assumes independence is worth pursuing - could alternatively have invested in training/supervision infrastructure

implicit_arguments.argument: Complexity should be hidden from novice users and managed by experts rather than taught to novices
implicit_arguments.assessment_notes: Fundamental UI/UX design philosophy - contrasts with alternative approach of training users in full GIS complexity. This is a meta-level assumption about how to design tools for novices.

implicit_arguments.argument: Ease of learning translates to sustained productivity and reduced frustration
implicit_arguments.assessment_notes: Links quick learning to continued use - assumes initial ease predicts ongoing success rather than, e.g., initial ease leading to shallow understanding that creates problems later

implicit_arguments.argument: Usability principles that work in dynamic field contexts (kinetic fieldwork) should transfer to static office-based digitization contexts
implicit_arguments.assessment_notes: The 'test' framing implies this hypothesis is being evaluated - assumption is that physical movement vs. stationary work doesn't fundamentally change usability requirements

implicit_arguments.argument: Interface familiarity and preference translate to learning ease and persistence
implicit_arguments.assessment_notes: Core HCI/usability assumption - that familiarity breeds competence and comfort breeds persistence. This is a foundational principle in user experience design that shapes the mobile-first decision.
implicit_arguments.coi_note: Authors are FAIMS developers who chose mobile platform - this assumption supports their platform choice

implicit_arguments.argument: Open-source and transparency are inherently valuable for research software
implicit_arguments.assessment_notes: Reflects disciplinary values in digital humanities/archaeology - open science paradigm where transparency and replicability are prioritized. This is a value statement that shapes tool selection criteria.

location.verbatim_quote: 1:50,000 scale Soviet military topographic maps dating to the 1980s

location.observation: Each map covers approximately 400 sq km
location.confidence_notes: Standard map tile size for this scale
location.verbatim_quote: each of these maps covers ca 400 sq km

location.observation: Symbol density averages about 200 per tile (0.5 per sq km)
location.assessor_notes: Average stated but no bounded range for variation
information_gaps: No standard deviation or confidence interval provided

expected_uncertainty.assessor_notes: Given that next sentence provides range (50-400), this average should ideally include measure of spread

location.verbatim_quote: averaging about 200 per tile (0.5 per sq km)

location.observation: Symbol counts per tile range from about 50 to 400
location.verbatim_quote: with counts per tile ranging from about 50 to 400

location.observation: Maps of Yambol region contained 1,000+ targeted symbols
location.confidence_notes: Lower bound provided with + indicating more
location.verbatim_quote: maps of the Yambol region contained 1,000+ of these targeted symbols

location.observation: Records to create were point + record number + ten attributes
location.verbatim_quote: The records we sought to create were relatively simple: a point for the feature, a record number, plus ten attributes

location.observation: Students came from Arts and Humanities backgrounds
location.verbatim_quote: Our students came from a range of academic backgrounds in Arts and Humanities

location.observation: Most students had no training in archaeology, cartography, or digital methods
location.confidence_notes: Project staff assessment of participant skills
location.verbatim_quote: Most had no training in archaeology, cartography, or digital methods

location.observation: In 2010, novice volunteers found learning desktop GIS challenging
location.assessor_notes: Based on author experience but no systematic measurement
information_gaps: No quantification of 'challenging' - attrition rates, time to competence, etc.

implicit_evidence.assessor_notes: Based on project experience but not systematically documented

location.verbatim_quote: novice volunteers found learning to configure and navigate desktop GIS challenging

location.observation: Many volunteers quit desktop GIS digitization in 2010
information_gaps: No percentage or count of attrition
location.verbatim_quote: many quit

location.observation: Volunteers who continued with desktop GIS required ongoing support
location.assessor_notes: Based on experience but not quantified
information_gaps: No quantification of 'ongoing support' - hours, frequency, etc.
location.verbatim_quote: those who continued required ongoing support

location.observation: 2010 approach with desktop GIS was unsuccessful
location.assessor_notes: Evaluative judgment rather than measured outcome
information_gaps: No specific success criteria stated against which to judge

implicit_evidence.assessor_notes: Success/failure judgment based on unstated criteria

location.verbatim_quote: volunteer attrition combined with demands on staff time during the height of fieldwork rendered this approach unsuccessful

location.observation: 2017 field season was short with little time for student training
information_gaps: No specific duration given for 'short' or 'little time'
location.verbatim_quote: In 2017, faced with a short field season and little time for student training

location.observation: FAIMS Mobile is a server-client platform for offline Android data collection
location.verbatim_quote: FAIMS Mobile is a server-client platform that generates customised Android applications for data collection during offline field research

location.observation: FAIMS Mobile had been used successfully for student ceramics recording
location.assessor_notes: Success qualified as 'some' - not unqualified success
information_gaps: What constitutes 'some success' vs. full success?
location.verbatim_quote: FAIMS Mobile had previously been used with some success for a student-led ceramics recording project

location.observation: FAIMS Mobile improved recording efficiency in other settings
location.verbatim_quote: improved recording efficiency in other settings

location.observation: Digitization took place at field bases in rural Bulgaria
location.verbatim_quote: Our digitisation took place alongside fieldwork, at field bases in rural Bulgaria

location.observation: Reliable internet connectivity could not be guaranteed in rural Bulgaria
location.verbatim_quote: Reliable internet connectivity could not be guaranteed under these circumstances

location.observation: Only 2 of 12 students brought computers
location.verbatim_quote: only two of 12 students brought computers

location.observation: No students brought mice
location.verbatim_quote: none brought mice

location.observation: All students had mobile devices
location.verbatim_quote: but all had mobile devices

location.observation: Limited number of computers available in the field
location.verbatim_quote: limited number of computers

location.observation: Limited ESRI licenses available in the field
location.verbatim_quote: ESRI licences

location.observation: Limited desk space available in the field
location.verbatim_quote: desk space available in the field

location.observation: ArcGIS Collector requires internet connectivity at crucial setup stages
location.verbatim_quote: the need for internet connectivity at crucial stages of project setup

location.observation: ArcGIS Collector/Survey123 requires dividing map-centric and form-centric recording between two applications
location.verbatim_quote: the need to divide map-centric and form-centric recording between the two applications and reconcile the data later

location.observation: Implementation stages included 7 distinct phases
location.verbatim_quote: The stages of FAIMS Mobile implementation (Fig. 3) included: (1) project staff modelled the data and workflow... (7) project staff undertook a targeted accuracy-checking exercise

location.observation: FAIMS Mobile automated multiple tasks including SRS application, map rendering, layer management, topology enforcement, vocabulary display, metadata recording, history maintenance, validation, merging, and export
location.verbatim_quote: It applied the spatial reference system, rendered maps in the workspace, provided layer management (including a data entry layer), enforced shape topology, displayed pre-defined controlled vocabularies for attribute terms, recorded creation time and author for each record, maintained a history of all changes to data, applied validation to ensure record completeness, merged data from multiple devices, and exported data in common formats

location.observation: Digitization interface was streamlined with minimal controls
location.verbatim_quote: The digitisation interface itself was as streamlined as possible

location.observation: Interface included map view and form view
location.verbatim_quote: Volunteers could toggle between a map view for geospatial data interactions and a form view for attribute creation and editing

location.observation: Map view allowed layer focus/visibility adjustment, pan, and zoom
location.verbatim_quote: In the map, they could adjust layer focus and visibility, pan, and zoom

location.observation: Existing records could be searched, retrieved, inspected, and edited
location.verbatim_quote: Existing records could be searched, retrieved, inspected, and edited

location.observation: Project staff preprocessed and loaded maps
location.verbatim_quote: Since project staff set up the infrastructure and pre-processed and loaded the required maps

location.observation: Users only needed to select files, pan/zoom map, drop points, and fill forms
location.verbatim_quote: Students capable of selecting files from a list, panning and zooming a map, dropping a point, and filling out a form were able to create data

location.observation: Only a few important controls were present in the interface
information_gaps: Exact number not specified but enumerated in text
location.verbatim_quote: Only a few important controls, including layer management, map navigation, record search and retrieval, and shape and attribute creation and editing, were present

location.observation: Exported data adhered to FAIR principles F2, R1.1-1.3
location.assessor_notes: Self-assessment of FAIR compliance, not third-party verified

implicit_evidence.assessor_notes: Authors explain which principles (rich/plural metadata at creation) but not how compliance was verified

location.verbatim_quote: This data adhered to key elements of the FAIR data principles, especially the production of 'rich' and 'plural' metadata at the time of data creation (principles F2, R1.1–1.3

location.observation: Code and documentation available on GitHub
location.verbatim_quote: The code defining this customisation, along with a description and user guide, can be found on GitHub (https://github.com/FAIMS/map-digitisation/releases/tag/map-dig-2018)

location.observation: Decision to catalogue inputs/outputs was made early in 2017 season
location.verbatim_quote: At that point, we decided to catalogue inputs (time invested by staff and volunteers) versus outputs (features digitised)

location.observation: Inputs measured included programmer time, volunteer time, and staff time for various activities
location.verbatim_quote: we collated the amount of time spent by various participants in the process, including the student programmer who instantiated the customisation, the student volunteers who undertook the digitisation, and project staff who configured the system, supported volunteers, exported data, and checked for errors

location.observation: Project records provided programmer timesheets
location.verbatim_quote: timesheets from the programmer

location.observation: Student time came from record creation timestamps
location.verbatim_quote: record creation timestamps for students using the system

location.observation: Staff logged time-on-task in journals
location.assessor_notes: Manual logging subject to recording accuracy
information_gaps: No indication of logging frequency or granularity
location.verbatim_quote: project staff logged time-on-task for activities in journals

location.observation: Output measured was number of features digitized
location.verbatim_quote: We took the number of features digitised as the output

location.observation: Additional care taken in 2018 to ensure complete records

implicit_evidence.assessor_notes: Claim about data quality improvement without specifying what changed

location.verbatim_quote: Additional care was taken in the subsequent 2018 season to ensure these records were as complete as possible

location.observation: 2018 data used to confirm 2017 time estimates
location.assessor_notes: Validation approach reasonable but not detailed

implicit_evidence.assessor_notes: Validation claimed but methodology not specified

location.verbatim_quote: confirm 2017 time estimates for system set-up, administration, and support in the field

location.observation: Staff reviewed randomly selected digitization work
location.assessor_notes: Random sampling appropriate for quality assessment
information_gaps: Sample size not specified in Methods
location.verbatim_quote: project staff reviewed randomly selected digitisation work completed by volunteers to characterise errors

claims.claim_text: TRAP staff created a simplified and streamlined data capture system using FAIMS Mobile platform
claims.verbatim_quote: TRAP staff created a simplified and streamlined data capture system built using the FAIMS Mobile platform

claims.claim_text: The system allowed any number of participants to digitise map features using mobile devices regardless of network connectivity
claims.verbatim_quote: This system allowed any number of participants to digitise map features using mobile devices, regardless of network connectivity

claims.claim_text: The approach and technologies can scale to accommodate large numbers of contributors
claims.assessor_notes: Scalability claim based on project experience but not tested at scale
claims.verbatim_quote: both the approach and the technologies applied can scale to accommodate large numbers of contributors

claims.claim_text: A similar approach could be developed using other platforms
claims.assessor_notes: Transferability claim - important for generalizability but speculative
claims.verbatim_quote: A similar approach could also be developed using other platforms

claims.claim_text: Mound symbols were moderately obtrusive with some shape/color shared with other map symbols
claims.verbatim_quote: The mound symbols were moderately obtrusive; some aspects of shape or colour were shared with other map symbols

claims.claim_text: The 2017 approach focused on implementing tools that would empower volunteers to work independently
claims.verbatim_quote: we focused on implementing tools that would empower volunteers to digitise maps independently

claims.claim_text: The approach sought to help novice users begin quickly and work productively with minimal support or frustration
claims.verbatim_quote: Our approach sought to help novice users begin digitising quickly and then work productively for the duration of each field season with minimal support or frustration

claims.claim_text: The approach stripped GIS functionality to its essentials: layer selection, shape digitisation, and annotation
claims.verbatim_quote: it stripped GIS functionality to its essentials, focusing on three tasks: layer selection, shape digitisation, and annotation

claims.claim_text: Validation and automation were added to improve data quality
claims.verbatim_quote: with validation and automation to improve data quality

claims.claim_text: Geospatial data preparation and management was relegated to staff
claims.verbatim_quote: Geospatial data preparation and management was relegated to staff

claims.claim_text: A simple and intuitive UI allowed students to begin digitising after only minutes of training
claims.assessor_notes: Key usability claim but not systematically measured

implicit_evidence.assessor_notes: Training time claim without measurement documentation

expected_uncertainty.assessor_notes: Claim about training time without documenting how it was measured or bounded range

claims.verbatim_quote: while a simple and intuitive UI allowed students to begin digitising after only minutes of training

claims.claim_text: The approach was refined during the 2018 field season
claims.verbatim_quote: This approach was refined during the 2018 field season

claims.claim_text: FAIMS Mobile can collect, manage, and bind spatial, structured, multimedia, and text data as part of a single record
claims.coi_note: Authors are FAIMS developers - claim about their own platform's capabilities
claims.verbatim_quote: It can collect, manage, and bind spatial, structured, multimedia, and text data as part of a single record, obviating the need to use multiple applications

claims.claim_text: FAIMS Mobile obviates the need to use multiple applications
claims.coi_note: Authors are FAIMS developers - advantage claim about their own platform
claims.verbatim_quote: obviating the need to use multiple applications

claims.claim_text: The system is designed for field research with the goal of requiring as few compromises from researchers or fieldworkers as possible
claims.coi_note: Authors are FAIMS developers - design philosophy of their own platform
claims.verbatim_quote: The system is designed for field research, with the goal of requiring as few compromises from researchers or fieldworkers as possible

claims.claim_text: A system that tolerated degraded network connectivity was required
claims.verbatim_quote: a system that tolerated degraded network connectivity was required

claims.claim_text: Digitisation work associated with archaeological research often proceeds under conditions of degraded network connectivity
